original_solution_mapping.L1: If Danielle drives at three times the speed of Cameron, it will take Cameron 30*3=<<30*3=90>>90 minutes for Cameron to travel the same distance.
original_solution_mapping.L2: And since Cameron drives at twice the speed of his brother, Chase, it will take Chase 90*2=<<90*2=180>>180 minutes to travel from Granville to Salisbury.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3723.
    Returns: the time it will take Chase to travel from Granville to Salisbury in minutes.
    """
    # L1
    danielle_travel_time = 30 # 30 minutes to travel from Granville to Salisbury
    danielle_speed_multiplier = 3 # three times the speed of Cameron
    cameron_travel_time = danielle_travel_time * danielle_speed_multiplier

    # L2
    cameron_speed_multiplier = 2 # twice the speed of his brother, Chase
    chase_travel_time = cameron_travel_time * cameron_speed_multiplier

    # FA
    answer = chase_travel_time
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If Danielle drives at three times the speed of Cameron, it will take Cameron {danielle_travel_time}*{danielle_speed_multiplier}=<<{danielle_travel_time}*{danielle_speed_multiplier}={cameron_travel_time}>>{cameron_travel_time} minutes for Cameron to travel the same distance.

And since Cameron drives at twice the speed of his brother, Chase, it will take Chase {cameron_travel_time}*{cameron_speed_multiplier}=<<{cameron_travel_time}*{cameron_speed_multiplier}={chase_travel_time}>>{chase_travel_time} minutes to travel from Granville to Salisbury.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If Danielle drives at three times the speed of Cameron, it will take Cameron 3*3=<<3*3=9>>9 minutes for Cameron to travel the same distance.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: And since Cameron drives at twice the speed of his brother, Chase, it will take Chase 9*2=<<9*2=18>>18 minutes to travel from Granville to Salisbury.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'danielle_speed_multiplier' (3) was used instead of 'danielle_travel_time' (30).
